Authors: Srihadi T.F., Hartoyo, Sukandar D., Soehadi A.W.
Title: Segmentation of the tourism market for Jakarta: Classification of foreign visitors' lifestyle typologies
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bogor Agricultural University (IPB), Bogor, Indonesia; Prasetiya Mulya Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Srihadi, T.F., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hartoyo, Bogor Agricultural University (IPB), Bogor, Indonesia; Sukandar, D., Bogor Agricultural University (IPB), Bogor, Indonesia; Soehadi, A.W., Prasetiya Mulya Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Tourism market segmentation is considered a valuable marketing tool in creating an effective tourism marketing strategy. This study investigated the differences in visitors' lifestyles that would potentially influence their selection of a holiday destination. The study used a set of activities, interests and opinion items to measure psychographic lifestyle typologies of foreign visitors who traveled to Jakarta. Factor analysis of the data identified six lifestyle factors, which were further analyzed using cluster analysis. The cluster analysis revealed four types of foreign visitors: culture interest shopaholic, sporty culture explorer, aspiring vacationer and want-everything vacationer. The four groups were compared through a chi-square test for independence analysis based on the types as well as the visitors' demographic profiles. Significant differences were found between the four groups in terms of age, race, employment status, number of previous trips to Jakarta, and travel companion. © 2016 The Authors.
Author Keywords: Activities; Cluster analysis; Interests and opinion (AIO); Psychographic lifestyle; Tourism segmentation

Authors: Srihadi T.F., Hartoyo, Sukandar D., Soehadi A.W.
Title: Brand equity model of Jakarta as an international tourist destination
Source title: Interdisciplinary Behavior and Social Sciences - Proceedings of the 3rd International Congress on Interdisciplinary Behavior and Social Sciences, ICIBSoS 2014
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bogor Agriculture University (IPB), Bogor, Indonesia; Prasetiya Mulya Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Srihadi, T.F., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hartoyo, Bogor Agriculture University (IPB), Bogor, Indonesia; Sukandar, D., Bogor Agriculture University (IPB), Bogor, Indonesia; Soehadi, A.W., Prasetiya Mulya Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This research was aimed to develop a conceptual model of destination brand equity of Jakarta and its relation to international tourists’ satisfaction and brand experience in building brand loyalty of Jakarta as a tourism destination.A survey-based quantitative approach was used to test the hypothesis and the proposed model. Empirical test using Structural Equation Model was conducted in the analysis. The findings showed that brand awareness, brand experience and tourist satisfaction have positive significant relationships with brand loyalty, where brand loyalty has a positive significant relationship with destination brand equity. The study also found that perceived quality and brand associations showed no significant relationship with brand loyalty. © 2015 Taylor and Francis Group, London.
Index Keywords: Marketing; Brand awareness; Brand loyalty; Conceptual model; Empirical test; Perceived quality; Quantitative approach; Structural equation modeling; Tourist destinations; Behavioral research
